metadata.name: Suspicious Schtasks Schedule Types
metadata.comment: Detects scheduled task creations or modification on a suspicious schedule type

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\schtasks.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('schtasks.exe') AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' onlogon ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' onstart ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' once ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' onidle '))) AND NOT (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('nt aut')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' system')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('highest'))))

output.summary: Detects scheduled task creations or modification on a suspicious schedule type

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate processes that run at logon. Filter according to your environment References: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-server/administration/windows-commands/schtasks-change, https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-server/administration/windows-commands/schtasks-create, http://blog.talosintelligence.com/2022/09/lazarus-three-rats.html
